Hi! We've received your issue and please be patient to get responded. 🎉
The average response time is expected to be within one day for weekdays.

In the meanwhile, please make sure that **you have posted enough image to demo your request**. You may also check out the [API](http://echarts.apache.org/api.html) and [chart option](http://echarts.apache.org/option.html) to get the answer.

If you don't get helped for a long time (over a week) or have an urgent question to ask, you may also send an email to dev@echarts.apache.org. Please attach the issue link if it's a technical questions.

If you are interested in the project, you may also subscribe our [mail list](https://echarts.apache.org/en/maillist.html).

Have a nice day! 🍵
They are missing in the document. It's available here: https://github.com/apache/incubator-echarts-doc/commit/8d001e86a2190b9ebdc2f344a7820a563ed9299a
Seems to be a bug with scrollable legend. Probably relates https://github.com/apache/incubator-echarts/blob/master/src/component/legend/ScrollableLegendView.js.

I believe this is not a bug. When you set `align` to be `'left'`, you need to set [`margin`](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#yAxis.axisLabel.margin) to be bigger, like 100. Because labels are aligned to margin.
@StoneMa Yes, @100pah meant that this feature should be improved.

> 它们在文档中丢失。在此处可用：[apache / incubator-echarts-doc @ 8d001e8](https://github.com/apache/incubator-echarts-doc/commit/8d001e86a2190b9ebdc2f344a7820a563ed9299a)

I'm sorry. Is that it
option={
...
	series: [{
	            type: 'graph',
	            layout: 'force',
	            .......
	            zoom:[3.97,3.71],
	            ......}]
}
If this is the case, the page will not display
@2675569545 This feature is currently not supported and we do not have plan to support in a short term. Keep this open if the community wants to contribute.
Yes, but `zoom` should be a number rather than an array.

> @2675569545 This feature is currently not supported and we do not have plan to support in a short term. Keep this open if the community wants to contribute.

Thanks for your reply.Have a good day at work.

> Yes, but `zoom` should be a number rather than an array.

Excuse me, there are a lot of nodes on the page, what is the API to get the coordinate axis information of an element? I found this, but the new version seems to be gone.
https://github.com/apache/incubator-echarts/issues/225
anyone has a solution ? also encounter the same problem

The average response time is expected to be within one day for weekdays.

In the meanwhile, please make sure that **you have posted enough image to demo your request**. You may also check out the [API](http://echarts.apache.org/api.html) and [chart option](http://echarts.apache.org/option.html) to get the answer.

If you don't get helped for a long time (over a week) or have an urgent question to ask, you may also send an email to dev@echarts.apache.org. Please attach the issue link if it's a technical questions.

If you are interested in the project, you may also subscribe our [mail list](https://echarts.apache.org/en/maillist.html).

I just try 4.7.0, looks like that version is working, any idea what should i do with 4.6.0 ? or i just have to upgrade to 4.7.0?

> 好像可以设置节点为fixed，来控制节点固定。但是还没试过新增节点会怎样。。。逐步踩坑中

  你好，请教一点问题，关于你说的layoutAnimation属性设置为false，是可以解决元素移动的问题的，但是官方建议超过一定数据量后不要设置为false，页面会假死。我试了一下，我这里的数据基本都在1000以上，如果碰到上万的数据量，浏览器就会假死。
  关于你说的节点设置为fixed，我尝试了，如果直接在数据中设置每个元素的fixed属性为true，页面将一个元素都不会显示（最上面的图例会显示）。也不会报错

Thanks for the answer, that's what I though about but it is not (for me) a good solution. I mean that you have to calculate that margin depending on labels font size and width. According to me it would be better to be able to align to left starting from the left of the graph area. Margin could be use but only to add some custom space. Currently if you work with dynamic values you just can't use that feature.

@2675569545 https://echarts.apache.org/zh/api.html#echartsInstance.convertToPixel
@pierrebonny Thanks for your suggestion. I will mark this as an improvement and see if the community can help. For now, I'm afraid you have to mannually set this value.

If 4.7.0 works fine, you should definitely upgrade. Please close this issue if 4.7.0 is ok.
Thanks!
请问和现在的 series-graph.force. edgeLength 区别是什么？为什么不能直接用这个？

For anyone who wish to fix this issue:
It's probably related to https://github.com/apache/incubator-echarts/blob/master/src/component/dataZoom/SliderZoomView.js#L38
You should provide a new option like `fillterSize` and replace the constant `DEFAULT_FILLER_SIZE`.

因為现在的 series-graph.force. edgeLength  區間 就算搭配 series-graph.force. repulsion 和series-graph.force. gravity 都會對全局造成影響，但我希望能表達出朋友中要好與普通朋友的差別，所以希望能個別自訂線段長度，或是把 series-graph.force. edgeLength 改成支援函式像d3的linkDistanceuu也是可以:
```javaScript
.linkDistance(function(link) { return link.distance }) 
```

Hi! We've received your issue and please be patient to get responded. 🎉
The average response time is expected to be within one day for weekdays.

In the meanwhile, please make sure that **you have posted enough image to demo your request**. You may also check out the [API](http://echarts.apache.org/api.html) and [chart option](http://echarts.apache.org/option.html) to get the answer.

If you don't get helped for a long time (over a week) or have an urgent question to ask, you may also send an email to dev@echarts.apache.org. Please attach the issue link if it's a technical questions.

If you are interested in the project, you may also subscribe our [mail list](https://echarts.apache.org/en/maillist.html).

Have a nice day! 🍵
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.
